raw_comment: The graph displays the average time when leaves begin to appear throughout the U.S. Leaves are a sign of the beginning of spring and the changing of seasons. The leaves seem to start appearing at the bottom of the graph (the south) and move up (north). The leaves begin to appear in the south first due to the warmer climate in the south. I notice that leaves begin to appear in parts of Washington and Oregon before other parts of the north so I wonder if certain parts of those states have a warmer climate earlier in the year?  A title for this graph could be â€œ Springing into Spring"
ace_sentences: The graph displays the average time when leaves begin to appear throughout the U.S.
Leaves are a sign of the beginning of spring.
Leaves are a sign of the changing of seasons.
In the graph, leaves seem to start appearing in the south.
In the graph, leaves seem to move north.
Leaves begin to appear in the south first.
The climate in the south is warmer than the climate in the north.
The warmer climate in the south causes leaves to appear earlier in the south.
In parts of Washington, leaves begin to appear before leaves begin to appear in other parts of the north.
In parts of Oregon, leaves begin to appear before leaves begin to appear in other parts of the north.
I wonder whether some parts of Washington have a warmer climate earlier in the year.
I wonder whether some parts of Oregon have a warmer climate earlier in the year.
A possible title for the graph is "Springing into Spring".
